Tech.name: RELIGIONCatholic
Tech.RolloverText: Christian religion dominant on most of the world.\nAllows the construction of one extra Abbey.

Tech.name: RELIGIONCatholic01
Tech.RolloverText: One Shipment.

Tech.name: RELIGIONCatholic02
Tech.RolloverText: Natives are 20% cheaper and train 20% faster.

Tech.name: RELIGIONCatholic03
Tech.RolloverText: Your buildings get +15% hitpoints.

Tech.name: RELIGIONCatholic04
Tech.RolloverText: Your Villagers pray 20% faster.

Tech.name: RELIGIONCatholic05
Tech.RolloverText: Your Abbeys now increase the gathering rates of nearby Villagers.

Tech.name: RELIGIONCatholic06
Tech.RolloverText: The Church demands dignity to the laborers! Villagers are 70% cheaper.

Tech.name: RELIGIONIslam
Tech.RolloverText: Middle-east religion strong in principles.\nImams train faster.

Tech.name: RELIGIONIslam01
Tech.RolloverText: Citizens go one month fasting. All units cost -5 Food.

Tech.name: RELIGIONIslam02
Tech.RolloverText: For the rest of the game, a small trickle of Faith enriches you.

Tech.name: RELIGIONIslam03
Tech.RolloverText: Blueprints are read faster. All buildings take 25% less time to be built.

Tech.name: RELIGIONIslam04
Tech.RolloverText: All resource crates include 50% more resources.

Tech.name: RELIGIONIslam05
Tech.RolloverText: Imams return from their pilgrimage to Mecca. Each Town Center and Town Center Caravan will spawn 3 Imams.

Tech.name: RELIGIONIslam06
Tech.RolloverText: The war against the infidels! Units get 40% stronger, but cost extra 100 Faith each.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAnglican
Tech.RolloverText: British religion founded by the monarchy.\nDeacons have larger range than regular priests.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAnglican01
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers pray by themselves, even if there's no Church.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAnglican02
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers grant 5 Faith upon creation.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAnglican03
Tech.RolloverText: Rectors are now able of praying.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAnglican04
Tech.RolloverText: The angels now bless your army! Infantry units cost -10% Food, but +25 Faith.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAnglican05
Tech.RolloverText: Reduces the Food Coin costs of all non-ultimate technologies by 50%.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAnglican06
Tech.RolloverText: All your unique religious technologies become available again.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAnglican01XX
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers pray by themselves, even if there's no Church.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAnglican02XX
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers grant 5 Faith upon creation.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAnglican03XX
Tech.RolloverText: Rectors are now able of praying.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAnglican04XX
Tech.RolloverText: The angels now bless your army! Infantry units cost -10% Food, but +25 Faith.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAnglican05XX
Tech.RolloverText: Reduces the Food Coin costs of all non-ultimate technologies by 50%.

Tech.name: RELIGIONOrthodox
Tech.RolloverText: Christian religion based on eastern traditions.\nHegumens spawn automatically.

Tech.name: RELIGIONOrthodox01
Tech.RolloverText: Hegumens hitpoints are doubled.

Tech.name: RELIGIONOrthodox02
Tech.RolloverText: Hegumens are spawn faster.

Tech.name: RELIGIONOrthodox03
Tech.RolloverText: Your melee units get bonuses against Spy-like units, Heroes and Priests.

Tech.name: RELIGIONOrthodox04
Tech.RolloverText: You get approximately 100 Coin for every 3 minutes of game length, up to 30 minutes.

Tech.name: RELIGIONOrthodox05
Tech.RolloverText: Military units give 30% more experience when trained.

Tech.name: RELIGIONOrthodox06
Tech.RolloverText: The divine grace blesses your army! Your military upgrades are now free.

Tech.name: RELIGIONBaptist
Tech.RolloverText: Christian religion dominant in the New World.\nUnique religious improvements are free, but they take longer to research.

Tech.name: RELIGIONBaptist01
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers cost -25% Food and +10 Faith.

Tech.name: RELIGIONBaptist02
Tech.RolloverText: The outpouring of the Holy Spirit! Pastors are trained instantly.

Tech.name: RELIGIONBaptist03
Tech.RolloverText: Changes your Coin for 80% that amount in Faith.

Tech.name: RELIGIONBaptist04
Tech.RolloverText: The Parish gets 100% more hitpoints and allows Settlers and Pastors can hide inside it.

Tech.name: RELIGIONBaptist05
Tech.RolloverText: Military units are 5% cheaper.

Tech.name: RELIGIONBaptist06
Tech.RolloverText: Your Houses/Teepees can train basic Barracks units in blocks of one./nCentral Americans must have a roster selected, and will only get units from their active roster.

Tech.name: RELIGIONJudaism
Tech.RolloverText: Ancient religion that favors traditional values.\nRabbis can pray at the Synagogue.

Tech.name: RELIGIONJudaism01
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers and Fishing Boats gather 5% faster from all resources.

Tech.name: RELIGIONJudaism02
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers pray 10% faster.

Tech.name: RELIGIONJudaism03
Tech.RolloverText: Rabbis trickle Coin.

Tech.name: RELIGIONJudaism04
Tech.RolloverText: An incoming wave of Jewish settlers from all over the world. Ships 12 Villagers.

Tech.name: RELIGIONJudaism05
Tech.RolloverText: 6 Sheeps are delivered at your Home City Gather Point.

Tech.name: RELIGIONJudaism06
Tech.RolloverText: The Day of Atonement! Military units cost -60% Food and +10 Faith.

Tech.name: RELIGIONLutheran
Tech.RolloverText: The first branch of Protestant Christianity, centered on the Gospel.\nOnce chosen, two Preachers spawn from Chapel.

Tech.name: RELIGIONLutheran01
Tech.RolloverText: Truth at all costs! Shared Temple technologies get 10% cheaper.

Tech.name: RELIGIONLutheran02
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers can now be trained at the Chapel for 75 Faith.

Tech.name: RELIGIONLutheran03
Tech.RolloverText: Reduces the non-Faith costs of all Temple technologies by 20%.

Tech.name: RELIGIONLutheran04
Tech.RolloverText: All market technologies get 40% cheaper.

Tech.name: RELIGIONLutheran05
Tech.RolloverText: Preachers cost 75% less.

Tech.name: RELIGIONLutheran06
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers train 50% faster.

Tech.name: RELIGIONShamanism
Tech.RolloverText: Religion based on native traditions and folk beliefs.\nShamans cost only Faith, free of Coin.

Tech.name: RELIGIONShamanismTupi
Tech.RolloverText: Religion based on native traditions and folk beliefs.\nShamans cost only Faith, free of Coin.

Tech.name: RELIGIONShamanism01
Tech.RolloverText: Shamans give you 30 Food when trained.

Tech.name: RELIGIONShamanism02
Tech.RolloverText: Buildings that can shoot can kill priests in one shot.

Tech.name: RELIGIONShamanism03
Tech.RolloverText: Military units cost -5% Food and have +5% hp.

Tech.name: RELIGIONShamanism04
Tech.RolloverText: Your units now heal themselves.

Tech.name: RELIGIONShamanism05
Tech.RolloverText: Native Warriors have 30% extra attack.

Tech.name: RELIGIONShamanism06
Tech.RolloverText: The stars open your eyes! An invisible unit with huge LoS begins to randomly explore the map.

Tech.name: RELIGIONCandomble
Tech.RolloverText: Religion mixing African religious traditions with Catholicism.\nBabalorix√°s have a strong hand attack and may critical hit.

Tech.name: RELIGIONCandomble01
Tech.RolloverText: After 10 minutes of having researched this technology, your villagers will get +10% gather rates.

Tech.name: RELIGIONCandomble02
Tech.RolloverText: Slaves, Baqueanos and Babalorix√°s have +20% hitpoints.

Tech.name: RELIGIONCandomble03
Tech.RolloverText: Reveals the location of all water resources.

Tech.name: RELIGIONCandomble04
Tech.RolloverText: Greatly reduces the price of Slave Trade, and your Villagers provide a tiny trickle of Experience.

Tech.name: RELIGIONCandomble05
Tech.RolloverText: All your units get +15 LoS.

Tech.name: RELIGIONCandomble06
Tech.RolloverText: The Orix√°s give you strength! Military unit hitpoints increased by 30%.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAtheismTupi
Tech.RolloverText: No state religion.\nAllows late-game scientific research and a cheaper healer, the Physician, who is unable to condemn.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAtheism
Tech.RolloverText: No state religion.\nAllows late-game scientific research and a cheaper healer, the Physician, who is unable to condemn.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAtheism01
Tech.RolloverText: Physicians cost half the price, and get twice the hitpoints.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAtheism02
Tech.RolloverText: Town Center line of sight greatly increased.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAtheism03
Tech.RolloverText: Artillery units get +4 range.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAtheism04
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers gather Food from Mills, Farms, Rice Paddies and berries and Coin from Plantations faster.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAtheism05
Tech.RolloverText: Economic units get 50% more hitpoints.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAtheism06
Tech.RolloverText: Aging up is done 50% faster.

Tech.name: RELIGIONfaith01
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers pray 20% more intensely, and will gather all other resources faster.

Tech.name: RELIGIONfaith02
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers pray 15% more intensely, and will gather all other resources faster.

Tech.name: RELIGIONfaith03
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers pray 15% more intensely, and will gather all other resources faster.

Tech.name: RELIGIONfaith04
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers pray 10% more intensely, and will gather all other resources faster.

Tech.name: colonializeUSAyes
Tech.RolloverText: "Should we import goodies from Europe?"\nYES: Home City shipments arrive faster, but unit upgrades are more expensive.\nNO: Unit upgrades are cheaper, but Home City shipments take longer to arrive.

Tech.name: industrializeUSAyes
Tech.RolloverText: "Should white men and black men have the same rights?"\nYES: All your African Slaves transform into Pioneers.\nNO: All your Pioneers transform into African Slaves.

Tech.name: imperializeUSAyes
Tech.RolloverText: "Should we support international revolutions?"\nYES: Revolting is cheaper, but Aging up is more expensive.\nNO: Aging up is cheaper, but Revolting is more expensive.

Tech.name: colonializeCSAyes
Tech.RolloverText: "Should slaves sleep inside our homes?"\nYES: African Slaves gather from all resources faster, but Houses hold less population.\nNO: Houses can hold more population, but African Slaves gather slower for all resources.

Tech.name: fortressizeCSAyes
Tech.RolloverText: "Should we use the Africans in our army?"\nYES: Infantry units have increased hitpoints, but deal less damage.\nNO: Infantry units have increased attack, but have less hitpoints.

Tech.name: industrializeCSAyes
Tech.RolloverText: "Should revenues collected in one state fund improvements in another state?"\nYES: All your Coin is exchanged for a greater amount of Food.\nNO: All your Food is exchanged for a greater amount of Coin.

Tech.name: imperializeCSAyes
Tech.RolloverText: "Should we go against international slave traffic?"\nYES: African Slave cost changed from Coin to Food.\nNO: Pilgrim cost changed from Food to Coin.

Tech.name: colonializeBRITISH2yes
Tech.RolloverText: "Should we favor immigration from Europe?"\nYES: Home City shipments arrive faster, but Pioneers move slower.\nNO: Pioneers move faster, but Home City shipments take longer to arrive.

Tech.name: fortressizeBRITISH2yes
Tech.RolloverText: "Should we support international revolutions?"\nYES: Revolting is cheaper, but Aging up is more expensive.\nNO: Aging up is cheaper, but Revolting is more expensive.

Tech.name: industrializeBRITISH2yes
Tech.RolloverText: "Should we export our extra timber?"\nYES: All your Wood is exchanged for a greater amount of Coin.\nNO: All your Food is exchanged for a greater amount of Coin.

Tech.name: imperializeBRITISH2yes
Tech.RolloverText: "Should we fortify our national borders over fortifying our own cities?"\nYES: Walls are stronger, but Town Centers have less hitpoints.\nNO: Town Centers are stronger, but walls have less hitpoints.

Tech.name: colonializeFRENCH2yes
Tech.RolloverText: "Should we forbid the religious from settling in our territory?"\nYES: All units have increased attack against enemy Priests, but your own Priests cost more Coin to train.\nNO: Priests are cheaper, but your units are less effective at attacking enemy Priests.

Tech.name: fortressizeFRENCH2yes
Tech.RolloverText: "Should we create indian reserves?"\nYES: Native warriors have more hitpoints, but they will cost Coin to train.\nNO: Native warriors cost less Food to train, but have less hitpoints.

Tech.name: industrializeFRENCH2yes
Tech.RolloverText: "Should adopt blue as the national color?"\nYES: Infantry hitpoints increased, but cavalry unit have less hitpoints.\nNO: Cavalry hitpoints increased, but infantry units have less hitpoints.

Tech.name: imperializeFRENCH2yes
Tech.RolloverText: "Should we sell our unused territories to our neighbors?"\nYES: For the rest of the game, a small tricke of Coin enriches you.\nNO: For the rest of the game, a small tricke of Food enriches you.

Tech.RolloverText: "Should we import goodies from Europe?"\nYES: Home City shipments arrive faster, but unit upgrades are more expensive.\nNO: Unit upgrades are cheaper, but Home City shipments take longer to arrive.

Tech.RolloverText: "Should we support international revolutions?"\nYES: Revolting is cheaper, but Aging up is more expensive.\nNO: Aging up is cheaper, but Revolting is more expensive.

Tech.name: RELIGIONBuddhism
Tech.RolloverText: Religion that seeks the path to enlightenment.\nYour Bhikkhu regenerates.

Tech.name: RELIGIONBuddhism01
Tech.RolloverText: Replaces your Villagers' Food cost with a slightly smaller Faith cost. If the Zen Diet Card is sent, the Wood cost is also replaced by an even smaller Faith cost.

Tech.name: RELIGIONBuddhism02
Tech.RolloverText: Bhikkhu hitpoints greatly increased.

Tech.name: RELIGIONBuddhism03
Tech.RolloverText: Bhikkhus/Bettou now increase the gather rate of nearby villagers.

Tech.name: RELIGIONBuddhism04
Tech.RolloverText: Extinguish the flames of suffering! Decreases the attack of your villagers, in exchange for a faster Faith gather rate.

Tech.name: RELIGIONBuddhism05
Tech.RolloverText: Your religious leaders (Monks and Bhikkhus/Bettou) regenerate faster.

Tech.name: RELIGIONBuddhism06
Tech.RolloverText: Your Bhikkhu can build a Buddha Statue, next to which units cannot fight.

Tech.name: RELIGIONHinduism
Tech.RolloverText: Indian religion consisted of a mix of many different traditions and philosophies.\nYour Acharya is more resistant to ranged attacks.

Tech.name: RELIGIONHinduism01
Tech.RolloverText: Acharyas now reduce nearby enemies' speed.

Tech.name: RELIGIONHinduism02
Tech.RolloverText: Acharyas increase nearby units' damage on death.

Tech.name: RELIGIONHinduism03
Tech.RolloverText: Get 1 free Acharya with every unique religious improvement after this one; +1 Acharya.

Tech.name: RELIGIONHinduism04
Tech.RolloverText: Improvements research faster.

Tech.name: RELIGIONHinduism05
Tech.RolloverText: Acharyas return their Coin cost on death.

Tech.name: RELIGIONHinduism06
Tech.RolloverText: The last Avatar of Vishnu is called to Earth to fight for your cause for two minutes.

Tech.RolloverText: Protestant religion emphasizing the grace of God and predestination.\nYour Huguenots can build Trading Posts.

Tech.RolloverText: Units cost 10% less Coin.

Tech.name: RELIGIONCalvinism02
Tech.RolloverText: God has ordained! Units produce 10% more Experience when trained.

Tech.name: RELIGIONCalvinism03
Tech.RolloverText: Huguenots gain the ability to become temporarily invulnerable.

Tech.name: RELIGIONCalvinism04
Tech.RolloverText: Exchanges Faith costs on religious improvements and Huguenots for Coin.

Tech.name: RELIGIONCalvinism05
Tech.RolloverText: When this improvement is researched, all of your current Faith is exchanged for a greater amount of Coin.

Tech.name: RELIGIONCalvinism06
Tech.RolloverText: All your other religious improvements are instantly researched.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAnimism
Tech.RolloverText: Religion that focuses on life after death.\nYour Seer is a better healer.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAnimism01
Tech.RolloverText: Seer speed and line of sight increased.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAnimism02
Tech.RolloverText: Further increases the capacity of your Seers of healing units.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAnimism03
Tech.RolloverText: Units take longer to train, but their attack is increased.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAnimism04
Tech.RolloverText: Villager hitpoints increased by 15% and they gather from natural resources 15% faster.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAnimism05
Tech.RolloverText: When a Seer dies, it provides a 5% Hitpoint bonus to all nearby units for 5 seconds.

Tech.name: RELIGIONAnimism06
Tech.RolloverText: The spirits of your ancestors protect you! Town Centers increase nearby units' Attack, Hitpoints, Speed, and Gather Rates.

Tech.name: RELIGIONHeliolatry
Tech.RolloverText: Religion based on the worship of the Sun.\nYour Diviner has greater line of sight.

Tech.name: RELIGIONHeliolatry01
Tech.RolloverText: Your Diviners will slowly trickle Experience over time.

Tech.name: RELIGIONHeliolatry02
Tech.RolloverText: Units get 10% more attack, but they get -5% less hitpoints.

Tech.name: RELIGIONHeliolatry03
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers gather Food from berries faster.

Tech.name: RELIGIONHeliolatry04
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers gather Food from economic buildings faster.

Tech.name: RELIGIONHeliolatry05
Tech.RolloverText: Home City shipments arrive faster.

Tech.name: RELIGIONHeliolatry06
Tech.RolloverText: The Sun has come! Explorer attack and hitpoints significantly increased. Inca Chasquis' attack and hitpoints greatly increased.

Tech.name: RELIGIONShinto
Tech.RolloverText: Japanese folk religion.\nYour Kannushi boosts the gather rate of nearby Shrines.

Tech.name: RELIGIONShinto01
Tech.RolloverText: Gashou! Your Shrines gain an aura that slightly increases nearby units' hitpoints.

Tech.name: RELIGIONShinto02
Tech.RolloverText: Your Jinja will slowly spawn Villagers over time.

Tech.name: RELIGIONShinto03
Tech.RolloverText: Villager hitpoints and speed increased.

Tech.name: RELIGIONShinto04
Tech.RolloverText: Increases the build limit of native settlement units.

Tech.name: RELIGIONShinto05
Tech.RolloverText: Your Villagers become more resistant to melee attacks.

Tech.name: RELIGIONShinto06
Tech.RolloverText: Secularize your colony, allowing you to research Laicist techs.\nYour Rigaku-sha can no longer condemn, but is cheaper.

Tech.name: RELIGIONShinto06Buddhism
Tech.RolloverText: A syncretic religion amalgamating Shinto and Buddhist practices. Allows you to research Buddhist techs.\nYour Bettou regenerates.

Tech.name: RELIGIONShinto06Taoism
Tech.RolloverText: A syncretic practice based on Taoist philosophies. Allows you to research Taoist techs.\nYour Onmyouji moves faster.

Tech.name: RELIGIONTaoism
Tech.RolloverText: Religion that emphasizes living in harmony.\nYour Daoshi moves faster.

Tech.name: RELIGIONTaoism01
Tech.RolloverText: Market improvements are cheaper.

Tech.name: RELIGIONTaoism02
Tech.RolloverText: Reveals all treasures on the map.

Tech.name: RELIGIONTaoism03
Tech.RolloverText: When this improvement is researched, all of your current Coin is exchanged for a greater amount of Faith.

Tech.name: RELIGIONTaoism04
Tech.RolloverText: All your buildings have 20% more hitpoints.

Tech.name: RELIGIONTaoism05
Tech.RolloverText: Native units train faster and cost less.

Tech.name: RELIGIONTaoism06
Tech.RolloverText: All units are 20% cheaper. Villager and Fishing boats gather 20% faster from all resources. Does not affect Export costs.

Tech.name: HCCamasCalientes
Tech.RolloverText: Houses support double the population; +100 Food.

Tech.name: HCCombateIquique
Tech.RolloverText: Corvette attack and hitpoints greatly increased, and now they give more experience points when built; +100 Wood.

Tech.name: HCAnimita

Tech.name: HCEasterIsland

Tech.RolloverText: Rotos move faster and have more line of sight; +100 Coin.

Tech.RolloverText: Enables the training of Mares at Mills, which can gather Food; +100 Food.

Tech.name: WOLReligionCalvinismTupi06
Tech.RolloverText: All your other religious improvements are instantly researched.

Tech.name: WOLReligionShamanismTupi
Tech.RolloverText: Religion based on native beliefs.\nShamans cost only Faith.

Tech.name: WOLReligionShamanismTupi01
Tech.RolloverText: Shamans give you 30 Food when trained.

Tech.name: WOLReligionShamanismTupi02
Tech.RolloverText: Buildings that can shoot can kill priests in one shot.

Tech.RolloverText: Your units now heal themselves.

Tech.name: WOLReligionShamanismTupi05
Tech.RolloverText: Native Warriors have 30% extra attack.

Tech.name: WOLReligionShamanismTupi06

Ships the following ultimate units, depending on the National Age Princess chosen:
- 6 Scots Greys (Milady of Britain)
- 15 Foreign Legionnaires (Mademoiselle de Bourbon)
- 12 Ultramarinos (Infanta de Portugal)
- 3 Batidores (Princesa de Asturias)

- 1 Bank Wagon and 300 Coin (Princess of Orange)

- 1 Sawmill Wagon and 600 Wood (Kronprinsessa of Sweden)

Tech.RolloverText: Allows your Explorer to use Sealth and gives him the ability to use Counter-Intelligence to instantly kill enemy Spy-like units (Spies, Ninjas and Caudillos).

Tech.name: WOLHCCosaNostra
Tech.RolloverText: All your Architects transform into Camorristas.

Tech.name: WOLHCVenetianMask
Tech.RolloverText: Allows your Explorer to train Decoy Merchants to deceive the enemy.

Tech.name: WOLHCVitruvianMan
Tech.RolloverText: Receive for free all Explorer upgrades at the Capitol.

Tech.name: WOLHCOpera
Tech.RolloverText: Allows your Priests to slowly trickle Experience over time.

Tech.name: WOLHCDrama
Tech.RolloverText: Architects now decrease the gather rates of all enemy villagers.

Tech.name: WOLHCRisanamento
Tech.RolloverText: Buildings are built faster and have more hitpoints.

Tech.name: WOLHCArsMagna
Tech.RolloverText: Removes the Coin cost of all Arsenal improvements.

Tech.name: WOLHCItaliaTurrita
Tech.RolloverText: Alpino and Bersagliere unit upgrades are cheaper.

Tech.name: WOLHCPaviseShield
Tech.RolloverText: Crossbowman armor increased.

Tech.name: WOLHCSartiglia
Tech.RolloverText: Hussars move faster and are cheaper.

Tech.name: WOLHCPalio
Tech.RolloverText: Allows the training of Elmetis at the Saloon.

Tech.name: WOLHCRomanQuestion
Tech.RolloverText: All units can now instantly kill enemy Priests, but your own Priests will take more time to train.

Tech.name: WOLHCFilioque
Tech.RolloverText: Treasure guardians condemned by Priests are transformed into Merchants.

Tech.name: WOLHCRegatta
Tech.RolloverText: Ships move faster.

Tech.name: WOLHCGondola
Tech.RolloverText: Fishing Boats now trickle Experience.

Tech.name: WOLHCMareNostrum
Tech.RolloverText: Building attack against ships increased.

Tech.name: WOLHCViticulture
Tech.RolloverText: Receive for free all Food production upgrades at the Vineyard.

Tech.name: WOLHCWineCellar
Tech.RolloverText: Vineyards produce resources slighty faster.

Tech.name: WOLHCPasta
Tech.RolloverText: After the arrival of this Shipment, all your crate cards will bring additional Crates of Food.

Tech.name: WOLHCCamiseRosse
Tech.RolloverText: Ships a number of Garibaldine Redshirts.

Tech.name: WOLHCRenaissance
Tech.RolloverText: All improvements are cheaper and research faster.

Tech.name: WOLHCItaliaIrredenta
Tech.RolloverText: All your Pikemen transform into Alpinos.

Tech.name: WOLHCOmerta
Tech.RolloverText: Merchants now boost the attack and hitpoints of Camorristas.

Tech.name: WOLHCPontificalGuard
Tech.RolloverText: Ships a number of Pontifical Guards (Swiss Pikemen) and Pontifical Zouaves (Corporal Zouaves).

Tech.name: WOLHCShipBasilicaWagon
Tech.RolloverText: Ships a Basilica Wagon to your colony, allowing you to construct a Basilica.

Tech.name: WOLHCPapalBullae
Tech.RolloverText: Ships 5 Priests and 2 Inquisidors.

Tech.name: WOLHCLinenSuit
Tech.RolloverText: Receive for free all Mafioso hitpoints upgrades.

Tech.name: WOLHCUnforgivableSin

Tech.name: WOLHCMarbleSculptors
Tech.RolloverText: Marble Statue hitpoints increased.

Tech.name: WOLHCAdvancedReligionAustralian
Tech.RolloverText: Priests have 100% more hitpoints; Inquisitors, which are religious Spies, are enabled at the Temple.

Tech.name: WOLReligionAtheismAustralian
Tech.RolloverText: No state religion.\nAllows late-game scientific research and a cheaper healer, the Physician, who is unable to condemn.

Tech.name: WOLReligionAtheismAustralian01
Tech.RolloverText: Physicians cost half the price, and get twice the hitpoints.

Tech.name: WOLReligionAtheismAustralian02
Tech.RolloverText: Town Center line of sight greatly increased.

Tech.name: WOLReligionAtheismAustralian03
Tech.RolloverText: Artillery units get +4 range.

Tech.name: WOLReligionAtheismAustralian04
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers gather Food from Mills, Farms, Rice Paddies and berries and Coin from Plantations faster.

Tech.name: WOLReligionAtheismAustralian05
Tech.RolloverText: Economic units get 50% more hitpoints.

Tech.name: WOLReligionAtheismAustralian06
Tech.RolloverText: Aging up is done 50% faster.

Tech.name: WOLReligionAnglicanAustralian
Tech.RolloverText: British religion founded by the monarchy.\nDeacons have larger range than regular priests.

Tech.name: WOLReligionAnglicanAustralian01
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers pray by themselves, even if there's no Church.

Tech.name: WOLReligionAnglicanAustralian02
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers grant 5 Faith upon creation.

Tech.name: WOLReligionAnglicanAustralian03
Tech.RolloverText: Rectors are now able of praying.

Tech.name: WOLReligionAnglicanAustralian04
Tech.RolloverText: The angels now bless your army! Infantry units cost -10% Food, but +25 Faith.

Tech.name: WOLReligionAnglicanAustralian05
Tech.RolloverText: Reduces the Food Coin costs of all non-ultimate technologies by 50%.

Tech.name: WOLReligionAnglicanAustralian06
Tech.RolloverText: All your unique religious technologies become available again.

Tech.name: WOLReligionAnimismAustralian
Tech.RolloverText: Religion that focuses on life after death.\nYour Seer is a better healer.

Tech.name: WOLReligionAnimismAustralian01
Tech.RolloverText: Seer speed and line of sight increased.

Tech.name: WOLReligionAnimismAustralian02
Tech.RolloverText: Units take longer to train, but their attack is increased.

Tech.name: WOLReligionAnimismAustralian03
Tech.RolloverText: When a Seer dies, it provides a 5% Hitpoint bonus to all nearby units for 5 seconds.

Tech.name: WOLReligionAnimismAustralian04
Tech.RolloverText: Villager hitpoints increased by 15% and they gather from natural resources 15% faster.

Tech.name: WOLReligionAnimismAustralian05
Tech.RolloverText: Further increases the capacity of your Seers of healing units.

Tech.name: WOLReligionAnimismAustralian06
Tech.RolloverText: The spirits of your ancestors protect you! Town Centers increase nearby units' Attack, Hitpoints, Speed, and Gather Rates.

Tech.name: AURCattleTech01
Tech.RolloverText: Herdables that produce milk take twice the time to fatten on the wild, but gather twice as fast from Pens.

Tech.name: AURManiocTech01
Tech.RolloverText: Infantry and villager hitpoints increased.

Tech.name: AURCocoaTech03

Tech.name: AURSaltTech01

Tech.name: AURSaltTech02
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers train faster.

Tech.name: AURSaltTech03
Tech.RolloverText: Ships a Salt Mine.

Tech.name: AURCoffeeTech03

Tech.name: AURVanillaTech01
Tech.RolloverText: You get approximately 1 Berry Bush for every 3 minutes of game length, up to 30 minutes.

Tech.name: AURVanillaTech02
Tech.RolloverText: Arrr! You get approximately 1 Pirate for every 2 minutes of game length, up to 30 minutes.

Tech.name: AURVanillaTech03
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers gather Food from berries faster.

Tech.name: AURTimberTech01
Tech.RolloverText: Buildings are slighty cheaper.

Tech.name: AURTimberTech02
Tech.RolloverText: Improves the attack and hitpoints of Explorers, War Chiefs, Monks and Fur Traders.

Tech.name: AURTimberTech03
Tech.RolloverText: Unit attack increased, but they have less hitpoints.

Tech.name: AURRubberTech01

Tech.name: AURRubberTech03

Tech.RolloverText: Villagers gather Food from hunted animals faster.

Tech.name: AURIvoryTech03
Tech.RolloverText: Unit hitpoints increased, but they have less attack.

Tech.RolloverText: Buildings provide more experience points when built.

Tech.name: AURTextilesTech02

Tech.name: AURTextilesTech03
Tech.RolloverText: Trading Posts will slowly trickle Coin over time.

Tech.RolloverText: When this improvement is researched, all of your current Wood is exchanged for a greater amount of Coin.

Tech.name: AURPalmOilTech02

Tech.name: AURPalmOilTech03

Tech.name: AURGoldTech01

Tech.name: AURGoldTech02
Tech.RolloverText: Building line of sight increased by +1 every Age Up.

Tech.name: AURGoldTech03
Tech.RolloverText: You get approximately 100 Coin in crates for every 3 minutes of game length, up to 30 minutes.

Tech.name: AURDiamondsTech01
Tech.RolloverText: Explorer line of sight increased.

Tech.name: AURDiamondsTech02
Tech.RolloverText: Explorer hitpoints increased.

Tech.name: AURDiamondsTech03
Tech.RolloverText: Ships a Diamond Mine.

Tech.name: AURTreasuresTech02
Tech.RolloverText: Effect not decided yet.

Tech.name: AURTreasuresTech03
Tech.RolloverText: Two Treasures appears at your Home City Gather Point.

Tech.name: AUROilTech01

Tech.name: AUROilTech02

Tech.name: AUROilTech03

Tech.name: WOTTAimmigrantSC01
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers and infantry move faster.

Tech.name: WOTTAimmigrantSC02
Tech.RolloverText: Fishing Boats gather Food and Coin faster.

Tech.name: WOTTAimmigrantSC03
Tech.RolloverText: Buildings have more line of sight and Villagers gather Faith slightly faster.

Tech.name: WOTTAimmigrantSC04
Tech.RolloverText: Bounty from training units and finishing buildings is increased.

Tech.name: WOTTAimmigrantSC05
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers train faster.

Tech.name: WOTTAimmigrantSC06
Tech.RolloverText: Naval units move faster.

Tech.name: WOTTAimmigrantSCBB
Tech.RolloverText: The ultimate Immigrant power. Researches Spies.

Tech.name: IMMIGRANTAsian
Tech.RolloverText: Trains:\nCoolies

Tech.name: IMMIGRANTIrish
Tech.RolloverText:
Trains:
Fenians
Wild Geese
Patricios

Tech.name: IMMIGRANTPolish
Tech.RolloverText: Trains:\nAuxiliaries\nInfernal Picadors

Tech.name: HCLandOwner
Tech.RolloverText: Improves your Cartographer in combat and he can now plant Crops.

Tech.name: HCScholar
Tech.RolloverText: Improves your Cartographer in combat and he now trickles experience points.

Tech.name: HCRoseValley
Tech.RolloverText: Enables Rose Crops, which produce Coin.

Tech.name: HCRafailsCross
Tech.RolloverText: Orthodoxy and its techs have their non-Faith costs removed.

Tech.name: HCThreeSeas
Tech.RolloverText: Warship line of sight and speed increased.

Tech.name: HCGreatSummer
Tech.RolloverText: All your Peasants transform into Opalchenets Poborniks. However, the hitpoints of Opalchenets Poborniks are greatly decreased.

Tech.name: HCChasoslov
Tech.RolloverText: Priest costs less Coin and half of their Faith cost.

Tech.name: HCGareMilitaire
Tech.RolloverText: Casern and Stable hitpoints greatly increased.

Tech.name: HCKapitansWar
Tech.RolloverText: Voivod attack and hitpoints increased.

Tech.name: HCVrhovism
Tech.RolloverText: You can now train Macedonian Komitis from Caserns.

Tech.name: HCExarchate
Tech.RolloverText: Doubles the build limit of Priests.

Tech.name: HCDairyProcessing
Tech.RolloverText: Allows you to train Sheep and Cows.

Tech.name: HCTeamCoveredBridge
Tech.RolloverText: Units, and especially artillery, move faster.

Tech.name: HCIstoriya
Tech.RolloverText: Priests heal much faster.

Tech.name: HCLevskisLegion
Tech.RolloverText: Artillery units, mercenaries and Native warriors can be trained in larger numbers.

Tech.name: HCTeamMartenitsa
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers gather Wood faster and have more hitpoints.

Tech.name: HCKukeri
Tech.RolloverText: Voivods now inflict fear on enemy units.

Tech.name: HCNestinarstvo
Tech.RolloverText: Villager and infantry hitpoints increased, and now Opalchenets can extinguish fires.

Tech.name: HCTeamFlowersDay
Tech.RolloverText: Temple and Priest hitpoints doubled.

Tech.name: HCVarnaPort
Tech.RolloverText: Docks now shoot even without a garrison.

Tech.name: HCVoivodCombat
Tech.RolloverText: Voivod attack and hitpoints increased

Tech.name: HCPeasantCombat
Tech.RolloverText: Peasant attack and hitpoints increased.

Tech.name: HCBulgarianRenaissance
Tech.RolloverText: Buildings constructed faster and have more hitpoints.

Tech.name: HCShipFoodCrates1Bulg
Tech.RolloverText: Food source.

Tech.name: HCShipWoodCrates1Bulg
Tech.RolloverText: Wood source.

Tech.name: HCShipCoinCrates1Bulg
Tech.RolloverText: Coin source.

Tech.name: HCShipWoodCrates2Bulg
Tech.RolloverText: Wood source.

Tech.name: PetOrcas
Tech.RolloverText: Caraja Animal Lore enables you to train Tame Cougars from your Town Center.

Tech.name: GovernorOfTheWoods
Tech.RolloverText: Escaped convict Michael Howe leads an outlaw gang completely beyond the reach of the authorities. All convicts assigned to you from this colony become bushrangers.

Tech.name: Ticket-of-Leave
Tech.RolloverText: Granting convicts parole improves their morale and motivation. Increases gather rates of convicts assigned from this colony.

Tech.name: ConvictBarracks
Tech.RolloverText: Construction of proper housing for the convicts increases the number that can be trained from this colony.

Tech.name: CatalpaRescue
Tech.RolloverText: The daring escape of six Irish political prisoners on the ship, Catalpa, spawns six Patricios.

Tech.name: DesertTransport
Tech.RolloverText: The Afghans make travel and trade in the Australian interior much easier. Trading Posts and Trade Route upgrades are cheaper.

Tech.name: HalalButchery
Tech.RolloverText: Muslim butchery methods increase gather rates from wild and domesticated animals.

Tech.name: MarreeMosque
Tech.RolloverText: Construction of the first mosque in Australia ships four Imams.

Tech.name: OutbackPioneers
Tech.RolloverText: The Afghans help open up the interior of the continent for settlement. Spawns six Muslim Settlers and a Covered Wagon.

Tech.name: TasHarpoon
Tech.RolloverText: Boats gather Food from Fish and Coin from Whales faster.

Tech.name: BrunyIslandLighthouse
Tech.RolloverText: Boats gather Food from Fish and Coin from Whales faster.

Tech.name: RoundShafts
Tech.RolloverText: The Chinese excavate round shafts, rather than the square ones the Europeans build. Enables faster mining.

Tech.name: JossHouse
Tech.RolloverText: Construction of the first Chinese temple in Australia spawns a Shaolin Master who can train disciples.

Tech.name: MarketGardeners
Tech.RolloverText: Many Chinese immigrants settle down to the farming life. Chinese Miners can now gather from agricultural buildings.

Tech.name: LambingFlatRiots
Tech.RolloverText: The Chinese community rushes to defend themselves from xenophobic rioters! Chinese miners can now train bands of Irregulars.

Tech.name: EthiopianWolves
Tech.RolloverText: Wolf native to the Ethiopian Highlands

Tech.name: Timkat
Tech.RolloverText: The Ethiopian Epiphany festival provides you with crates of Faith for every 2 minutes of the game, up to 30 minutes.

Tech.name: Tej
Tech.RolloverText: Ships 4 Beehive Wagons so you can make this honey mead. The national drink and communion wine of Ethiopia.

Tech.name: GeezScript
Tech.RolloverText: Learning to read texts in this ancient African language makes your priests cheaper and stronger.

Tech.name: PiousDebtera
Tech.RolloverText: Debtera hitpoints and build limit increased.

Tech.name: OrdainedDebtera
Tech.RolloverText: Debtera hitpoints and build limit increased.

Tech.name: WharenuiRahui
Tech.RolloverText: Declare a taboo on gathering resources in an area. Prevents your enemies from gathering resources near your Wharenui.

Tech.name: WharenuiPowhiri
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers gather faster when near your Trading Posts.

Tech.name: WharenuiHaka
Tech.RolloverText: Units have increased attack when near your Trading Posts.

Tech.name: WharenuiMusketTrade
Tech.RolloverText: All your Trading Posts gain a ranged attack.

Tech.name: FaleKava
Tech.RolloverText: Ritual consumption of the intoxicating drink. All your Trading Posts produce experience points.

Tech.name: FaleBubuti
Tech.RolloverText: The Kiribati system of compulsory gift-giving. All your Trading Posts produce Export.

Tech.name: FaleMissionaries
Tech.RolloverText: European priests arrive on the island. All your Trading Posts produce Faith.

Tech.name: FaleIslandEcosystem
Tech.RolloverText: Learning to live with the island's limited resources. All your Trading Posts spawn trees.

Tech.name: HCOrdoDraconum
Tech.RolloverText: Improves your Cartographer in combat.

Tech.name: HCImpaler
Tech.RolloverText: Improves your Cartographer in combat and gives him the ability to slow down enemy units.

Tech.name: HCRavenTrainer
Tech.RolloverText: Ships 1 Raven, improves its line of sight and allows the Cartographer to train more.

Tech.name: HCSteelCrown
Tech.RolloverText: Cartographer hitpoints increased and now he can train infantry units.

Tech.name: HCVladsHeir
Tech.RolloverText: Ships a second Cartographer.

Tech.name: HCExtendedFamilies
Tech.RolloverText: Roma Villagers train much faster.

Tech.name: HCLautari
Tech.RolloverText: Roma Villager hitpoints increased and Vardos improve their gathering rates.

Tech.name: HCRomanipen
Tech.RolloverText: Vardo hitpoints and speed increased.

Tech.name: HCCorvee
Tech.RolloverText: Roma Villager cost changed from Food to a lesser amount of Coin.

Tech.name: HCThymeHoney
Tech.RolloverText: Villagers gather Coin from Coin Crops faster.

Tech.name: HCMonstrousCoalition
Tech.RolloverText: Enables Patriotic and Boyar's upgrades for Scythemen and Hajduci.

Tech.name: HCCuzasReforms
Tech.RolloverText: When this Shipment arrives, all of your current Coin is exchanged for a greater amount of Wood.

Tech.name: HCTeamIslazProclamation
Tech.RolloverText: Late-game Food and Coin sources are cheaper.

Tech.name: HCTeamOina
Tech.RolloverText: Infantry melee attack and movement speed increased.

Tech.name: HCTeamTransylvanianFrontier
Tech.RolloverText: Cavalry provides more Experience upon being trained.

Tech.name: HCTeamRosiori
Tech.RolloverText: Cavalry attack and line of sight increased.

Tech.RolloverText: A small increase in attack but a huge increase in hitpoints.\nYour Purukumu become tough and defensive and have a small increase in range.

Tech.name: ExpertMusketMarauders
Tech.RolloverText: A moderate increase in both attack and hitpoints.\nYour Purukumu improve all-round and have bigger bonuses againt Heavy Infantry and Light Cavalry.

Tech.name: BraveMusketMarauders
Tech.RolloverText: Your Purukumu Marksmen have 20% greater hitpoints and 40% greater attack.

Tech.name: RecklessMusketMarauders
Tech.RolloverText: A small increase in hitpoints but a huge increase in attack.\nYour Purukumu become effective raiders but poor in sustained melee.

Tech.name: SwiftMusketMarauders
Tech.RolloverText: A moderate increase in both attack and hitpoints and an increase in movement speed.\nYour Purukumu move faster and improve all-round in combat.

Tech.name: TuparaMarauders
Tech.RolloverText: Upgrades your Marksmen to Tupara Marksmen. \nGood against Heavy Infantry and Light Cavalry. Has a powerful short range attack that deals area damage.

Tech.name: StrongTuparaMarauders
Tech.RolloverText: Your Tupara Marksmen have 40% greater hitpoints and 20% greater attack.

Tech.name: GuardTuparaMarauders
Tech.RolloverText: A small increase in attack but a huge increase in hitpoints.\nYour Tuparas become tough and defensive and have a small increase in range.

Tech.name: ExpertTuparaMarauders
Tech.RolloverText: A moderate increase in both attack and hitpoints.\nYour Tuparas improve all-round and have bigger bonuses againt Heavy Infantry and Light Cavalry.

Tech.name: BraveTuparaMarauders
Tech.RolloverText: Your Tupara Marksmen have 20% greater hitpoints and 40% greater attack.

Tech.name: RecklessTuparaMarauders
Tech.RolloverText: A small increase in hitpoints and a huge increase in attack. \nYour Tuparas become effective raiders but poor in sustained melee.

Tech.name: SwiftTuparaMarauders
Tech.RolloverText: A moderate increase in both attack and hitpoints and an increase in movement speed.\nYour Tuparas move faster and improve all-round in combat.

Tech.name: MereFighters
Tech.RolloverText: Upgrades your Fighters to Mere Fighters. \nStonger hand attack and faster movement than a standard Fighter.

Tech.name: StrongMereFighters
Tech.RolloverText: Your Mere Fighters have 40% greater hitpoints and 20% greater attack.

Tech.name: GuardMereFighters
Tech.RolloverText: A small increase in attack but a huge increase in hitpoints.\nYour Mere Fighters become tough and defensive.

Tech.name: ExpertMereFighters
Tech.RolloverText: A moderate increase in both attack and hitpoints.\nYour Mere Fighters improve all-round and deal more damage against Infantry.

Tech.name: BraveMereFighters
Tech.RolloverText: Your Mere Fighters have 20% greater hitpoints and 40% greater attack.

Tech.name: RecklessMereFighters
Tech.RolloverText: A small increase in hitpoints and a huge increase in attack, especially building attack.\nYour Mere Fighters become effective raiders but poor in sustained melee.

Tech.name: SwiftMereFighters
Tech.RolloverText: A moderate increase in both attack and hitpoints and an increase in movement speed.\nYour Mere Fighters move faster and improve all-round in combat.

Tech.name: HoeroaFighters
Tech.RolloverText: Upgrades your Fighters to Hoeroa Fighters. \nFights with a wide-area melee attack.

Tech.name: StrongHoeroaFighters
Tech.RolloverText: Your Hoeroa Fighters have 40% greater hitpoints and 20% greater attack.

Tech.name: GuardHoeroaFighters
Tech.RolloverText: A small increase in attack but a huge increase in hitpoints.\nYour Hoeroa Fighters become tough and defensive.

Tech.name: ExpertHoeroaFighters
Tech.RolloverText: A moderate increase in both attack and hitpoints.\nYour Hoeroa Fighters improve all-round and deal more damage against Infantry.

Tech.name: BraveHoeroaFighters
Tech.RolloverText: Your Hoeroa Fighters have 20% greater hitpoints and 40% greater attack.

Tech.name: RecklessHoeroaFighters
Tech.RolloverText: A small increase in hitpoints and a huge increase in attack, especially building attack.\nYour Hoeroa Fighters become effective raiders but poor in sustained melee.

Tech.name: SwiftHoeroaFighters
Tech.RolloverText: A moderate increase in both attack and hitpoints and an increase in movement speed.\nYour Hoeroa Fighters move faster and improve all-round in combat.

Tech.RolloverText: Introduction of European crops increases harvests. Kumara fields produce much more Food.

Tech.name: BigWarBoatGuns
Tech.RolloverText: Boats that train infantry can now train artillery.

Tech.RolloverText: Your warriors earn more Faith in combat.

Tech.RolloverText: Your warriors earn more Faith in combat.

Tech.name: HCExplorerCentralAmerica
Tech.RolloverText:
Improves your Alguacil in combat and grants him additional abilities, depending on your chosen roster.
Costa Rica: Your Alguacil has +2 Range and LOS (Age I), and can temporarily boost nearby Military's Attack and Hitpoints (Age IV).
El Salvador: Allows your Alguacil to use a stronger hand attack (Age I) and the Swashbuckler Attack (Age IV).
Honduras: Grants your Alguacil a tiny trickle of all resources (except Faith) that's enhanced by nearby Villagers (Age I), and allows him to train Catrachos (Age III).
Guatemala: Gives your Alguacil the ability to heal allies (Age I) and reduce nearby enemies' attack (Age III).
Nicaragua: Gives your Alguacil a horse, allowing him command your Cavalry more effectively (Age I) and use a lance attack in melee (Age IV).
Los Altos: Your Alguacil is 15% better in combat (Age I) and can use the Crackshot Attack (Age IV).
